dji.sdk.api.Battery

Class DJIBattery

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.Battery.DJIBattery
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DJIInspireBattery, DJIPhantomBattery

    public class DJIBattery
extends DJIObject

    Dji Drone Battery Base Class

    This class builds up a bridge between the app and the battery of drone. Developers could invoke the get() functions so that app could fully understand current information and status of battery. Also, developers could use the set() functions for controlling the frequency of feedback.

    As battery is one of the most restricted elements in drone, we recommend that developers should seriously consider the status of battery not only for aircraft safety but also for making sure that the aircraft could finish the tasks provided by app.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int intervel)
        Start update timer.
        After using this time, sdk itself will request the information and status from the drone battery.
        Parameters:
        intervel - Timer run interval
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully starting Update timer.
            false for informing failure.

      • stopUpdateTimer

        public boolean stopUpdateTimer()
        Stop update timer
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully stopping the updating timer
            false for informing failure.

      • setBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack

        public void setBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack(DJIBatteryUpdateInfoCallBack mCallBack)
        Set update battery information callback
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The update battery information callback.

        onResult(DJIBatteryProperty state) - the input parameter, state, contains information of battery, such as temperature, current and voltage.
        See Also:
        DJIBatteryProperty

        public void getSmartBatteryRestTimeForAll(DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Get rest time for all tasks under the control of Smart Battery.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The result callback.

        onResult(double result, DJIError mErr) - result is the time needed for finishing tasks and mErr could reflect the type of error.
        See Also:
        DJIError

      • getBatteryConnectionStatus

        public void getBatteryConnectionStatus(DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        This function will provide the connection status.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - - The callback will provide an object of DJIError which will contain the information about the command result. In addition, the result will provide the connection status. 0 - Normal, 1 - Invalid battery, 2 - communication exception

      • getBatteryErrorType

        public void getBatteryErrorType(DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Support List : Phantom 2 Series This function will return the error type. The error type contains the information about the battery itself and the connection status.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback will return the execution result of getting they type of error.
        onResult(double result, DJIError mErr) result is the error type code and mErr will return the status of battery error.

      • getBatteryErrorType

        public void getBatteryErrorType(DJIBatteryGetErrorTypeCallback mCallback)
        Support List: Phantom 3 Series, Inspire 1 This function is for getting the error type of the battery.
        Precondition : None
        PostCondition : the Callbakc will return the error type.
        Input : mCallback this is a callback to transport the integer(error type).
        Output : None

        They include : first level current
        second level current
        first level over heat
        second level over heat
        first level low temp
        second level low temp
        short circuit
        cell low voltage
        cell invalid
        cell replace

      • getBatteryHistoryStatus

        public void getBatteryHistoryStatus(DJIBatteryGetHistoryStatusCallBack mCallBack)
        This function will return the history status of the battery in last 31 times. The integers in the array means the battery statuses for last 31 times. The relationships between integer and status are as follow:
        0x00000001 - first level current
        0x00000002 - second level current
        0x00000004 - first level over heat
        0x00000008 - second level over heat
        0x00000010 - first level low temp
        0x00000020 - second level low temp
        0x00000040 - short circuit
        0x00000380 - cell low voltage
        0x00001C00 - cell invalid
        0x0000E000 - cell replace
        0x00010000 - watch dog rest
        0x00020000 - discharge
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The callback is designed for getting battery history status information such as overheat or low temperature. All of this information will be presented in integer format and the relating list is present above.

        onResult(int[] batteryHistoryStatus) - the batteryHistoryStatus is the array of historical status record. the size of this array is 31.

      • getBatterySelfDischargeDay

        public void getBatterySelfDischargeDay(DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Get the battery self-discharge day.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback will return the day of self-discharging

        onResult(double result, DJIError mErr) - result is the day of self-discharging and mErr will contain the request result (success or out-of-time).

      • setBatterySelfDischargeDay

        public void setBatterySelfDischargeDay(int days,
                                       DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Set up the day of self-discharge
        Parameters:
        days - it's the day how long the battery will discharge
        mCallBack - DJISmartBatteryExecuteResultCallback will return the day of self-discharging

        onResult(double result, DJIError mErr) - result is the day of self-discharging and mErr will contain the request result (success or out-of-time).

      • getPartVoltages

        public void getPartVoltages(DJIBatteryGetPartVoltageCallBack mCallBack)
        This function is used to get the voltage of the cells
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - DJIBatteryGetPartVoltageCallBack will return an array with voltages of cells
        onResult(int[] partVoltageValues) - partVoltageValues is an array of voltage of cells.

        Parameters:
        mCallBack - mCallBack is used to show the requesting version result.
